      • setInitialTimerTwoLength

        public void setInitialTimerTwoLength(int seconds)

      • getInitialTimerLength

        public int getInitialTimerLength()
        Gets the total length of the timer. Not to be confused with the current length, this value is where the timer will go to when restarting or starting after a stop. Gotten from the preferences API, defaults to 240 if no preference set yet.
        Returns:
        timer length in seconds
        See Also:
        setInitialTimerLength(int)

      • set

        public void set(int seconds)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Set the current value of the timer
        Parameters:
        seconds - a second value (non-negative)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O error occurs when accessing Timer.txt

      • get

        public int get()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the current value of the timer. If the timer file is empty or invalid, the default timer will be retrieved
        Returns:
        time left in seconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - timer.txt cannot be found
        java.io.IOException

      • convertToMinuteFormat

        public static java.lang.String convertToMinuteFormat(int totalSecs)
        Converts from seconds to MM:SS format
        Parameters:
        totalSecs -
        Returns:
        M:SS if totalSecs < 60, else MM:SS
